low.question: What advice does 'A stitch in time saves nine' give?
Which proverb encourages starting early to gain advantage?
options: The early bird catches the worm
Every cloud has a silver lining
A rolling stone gathers no moss
low.answer: The early bird catches the worm

low.question: What does 'When in Rome, do as the Romans do' advise?
Which proverb warns that appearances can mislead?
options: Don't judge a book by its cover
An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure
Make hay while the sun shines
low.answer: Don't judge a book by its cover

options: You cannot enjoy two mutually exclusive things
low.answer: You cannot enjoy two mutually exclusive things

options: Telling the truth is the wisest approach
low.answer: Telling the truth is the wisest approach

What is the meaning of 'Don't put all your eggs in one basket'?

options: Pots refuse to boil when observed

low.question: Complete: 'Don't bite off more than you can ___'
What does 'If it ain't broke, don't fix it' advise?
options: Avoid unnecessary changes to working things

medium.question: Which classical poet coined the Latin phrase 'Carpe diem'?
Which fable explains the lesson 'Slow and steady wins the race'?
Which historical figure reportedly said 'Alea iacta est' meaning 'The die is cast'?
Which poet wrote 'To err is human; to forgive, divine'?
Which author collected many English proverbs in the 17th century?
Which Aesop fable inspired the phrase 'sour grapes'?
Which proverb does the fable 'The Ant and the Grasshopper' illustrate?
Who is traditionally credited with authoring much of the Biblical Book of Proverbs?
Which proverb did Benjamin Franklin famously popularize?
options: A penny saved is a penny earned
Birds of a feather flock together
medium.answer: A penny saved is a penny earned

medium.question: Which proverb originates from Robert Burns' poem about mice and plans?
options: The best-laid plans of mice and men
A man's home is his castle
medium.answer: The best-laid plans of mice and men

medium.question: Which Shakespeare play contains the proverb 'All that glisters is not gold'?
Which proverb commonly summarizes the Golden Rule across cultures?
options: Do unto others as you would have them do unto you
medium.answer: Do unto others as you would have them do unto you

medium.question: Which saying suggests you should diversify investments?
options: Don't put all your eggs in one basket
Make hay while the sun shines
medium.answer: Don't put all your eggs in one basket

medium.question: Which proverb warns about misplaced confidence causing downfall from Proverbs 16:18?
options: He who laughs last laughs best

medium.question: Which proverb expresses skepticism about appearances using rhyme?
options: All that glitters is not gold
Don't judge a book by its cover
medium.answer: All that glitters is not gold

medium.question: Which proverb suggests immediate small fixes prevent larger problems later?
options: A stitch in time saves nine
Strike while the iron is hot
medium.answer: A stitch in time saves nine

medium.question: Which proverb implies impatience reduces perceived progress?
options: Slow and steady wins the race

medium.question: Which proverb expresses that reputation affects how others treat you?
options: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder
Birds of a feather flock together

medium.question: Which proverb encourages making the most of favorable conditions?
options: Make hay while the sun shines
medium.answer: Make hay while the sun shines

medium.question: Which proverb is summarized by 'Less is more' in modern phrasing?
options: Too much of a good thing
Brevity is the soul of wit
Rome wasn't built in a day
medium.answer: Too much of a good thing

medium.question: Which proverb warns not to assume success before it happens?
options: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
medium.answer: Don't count your chickens before they hatch

medium.question: Which proverb teaches that small consistent efforts produce results?
options: Strike while the iron is hot
Mend fences while the sun shines

medium.question: Which proverb implies the truth becomes obvious through practical testing?
options: The proof of the pudding is in the eating
All is fair in love and war
medium.answer: The proof of the pudding is in the eating

medium.question: Which proverb warns that gossip harms reputations and relationships?
options: A rumor without feet will die

medium.question: Which proverb suggests you should consider consequences before acting?
Which proverb implies impatience leads to mistakes and waste?
options: Time and tide wait for no man
Every cloud has a silver lining

medium.question: Which proverb tells you to avoid unnecessary risk by preparing backup plans?
options: Don't put all your eggs in one basket
Idle hands are the devil's workshop
medium.answer: Don't put all your eggs in one basket

medium.question: Which proverb means someone cares for their own interests above others'?

hard.question: What is the academic study of proverbs called?

hard.answer: A dialogue containing the number in effect of all the Prouerbes in the Englishe tongue

hard.question: Which novelist borrowed a line from Robert Burns for his title 'Of Mice and Men'?

Which literary device gives proverbs brevity and memorable form?
Which proverb study subfield focuses on how proverbs change in everyday use?
Which famous proverb about reputation appears in Proverbs 22:1 as 'A good name is more desirable than great riches'?
options: A good name is better than riches
Out of sight, out of mind
hard.answer: A good name is better than riches

hard.question: Which proverb-forming practice uses rhyme to aid memory, like 'Haste makes waste'?
Which proverb did Shakespeare write in As You Like It, meaning moderation benefits us?
options: Too much of a good thing
Neither a borrower nor a lender be
hard.answer: Too much of a good thing

hard.question: Which proverb term describes short moral sayings like 'Honesty is the best policy'?

options: An apple a day keeps the doctor away

options: Small causes can lead to big effects
hard.answer: Small causes can lead to big effects

hard.question: Which technical term denotes a proverb that functions as a cultural guideline?

options: The proof of the pudding is in the eating
A stitch in time saves nine
Birds of a feather flock together
hard.answer: The proof of the pudding is in the eating

options: Don't put all your eggs in one basket
hard.answer: Don't put all your eggs in one basket

hard.question: Which rare label describes a proverb used as an argument in folk law or oral testimony?

options: All that glisters is not gold
A rolling stone gathers no moss
Too many cooks spoil the broth
hard.answer: All that glisters is not gold

hard.question: Which ancient proverb source emphasizes teaching through short sayings and is part of wisdom literature?
Which technical field studies proverb variants, usage, and transformation in modern culture?

options: To err is human; to forgive, divine
Brevity is the soul of wit
hard.answer: To err is human; to forgive, divine
